comment: Block quotes don't use quote marks, per [[MOS:QUOTE]]

diff.*:
Line 144: Line 144:  
[[Rumi]], [[Hafiz Shirazi|Hafiz]] and [[Saadi (poet)|Sa'di]] are icons of the passion and love that the [[Culture of Iran|Persian culture]] and language present. The Persian word for love is ''eshgh'' {{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}, derived from the Arabic ''ishq'', however is considered by most to be too stalwart a term for interpersonal love and is more commonly substituted for 'doost dashtan' ('liking'){{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}. In the Persian culture, everything is encompassed by love and all is for love, starting from loving friends and family, husbands and wives, and eventually reaching the divine love that is the ultimate goal in life {{citation needed|date=October 2012}}. Over seven centuries ago, Sa'di wrote:
 
[[Rumi]], [[Hafiz Shirazi|Hafiz]] and [[Saadi (poet)|Sa'di]] are icons of the passion and love that the [[Culture of Iran|Persian culture]] and language present. The Persian word for love is ''eshgh'' {{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}, derived from the Arabic ''ishq'', however is considered by most to be too stalwart a term for interpersonal love and is more commonly substituted for 'doost dashtan' ('liking'){{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}. In the Persian culture, everything is encompassed by love and all is for love, starting from loving friends and family, husbands and wives, and eventually reaching the divine love that is the ultimate goal in life {{citation needed|date=October 2012}}. Over seven centuries ago, Sa'di wrote:
    −
::::''The children of Adam are limbs of one body''
+
{{quote|<poem>The children of Adam are limbs of one body
−
::::''Having been created of one essence.''
+
Having been created of one essence.
−
::::''When the calamity of time afflicts one limb''
+
When the calamity of time afflicts one limb
−
::::''The other limbs cannot remain at rest.''
+
The other limbs cannot remain at rest.
−
::::''If you have no sympathy for the troubles of others''
+
If you have no sympathy for the troubles of others
−
::::''You are not worthy to be called by the name of "man."''
+
You are not worthy to be called by the name of "man".</poem>}}
